physical_appearance:The image shows a photograph that is in black-and-white. There is an inner and outer border. Both of these borders are demarcated by a gold band. The surrounding frame is light red in colour. A man and a woman are featured in the photograph
 from head to toe. The lady is standing on the left hand side and she is wearing a sari
 while the man is wearing a long sleeved shirt
 pants
 and covered shoes. Both of them are looking in the direction where the photograph was captured. Both of them are wearing a neck accessory around their neck that holds a flower
 which hangs at their respective torsos.

subject_terms_3:Portrait photography Pioneers Kandiar
 Appavoo
sgcool_label_text:A native of Karuvakurichi village
 near Mannargudi town in Tamil Nadu
 S. Appavoo Kandiar was a general contractor specializing in pipe and cable laying
 handling of cargo and a concrete bricks supplier. Mr.Kandiar was a successful contractor; called a millionaire by the Straits Times in 1957
 he owned properties in Bukit Timah and Coronation Road areas. He was a contemporary of Indian pioneers such as P.Govindasamy Pillai
 Govindasamy Sarangapany
 Pakkirisami Pillai
 and had friendly associations with them.

metadata.title_text: Mr.Appavoo Kandiar and Mdm Chinnammal A Photograph of Mr.Appavoo Kandiar and Mdm Chinnammal
metadata.physical_appearance: The image shows a photograph that is in black-and-white. There is an inner and outer border. Both of these borders are demarcated by a gold band. The surrounding frame is light red in colour. A man and a woman are featured in the photograph, from head to toe. The lady is standing on the left hand side and she is wearing a sari, while the man is wearing a long sleeved shirt, pants, and covered shoes. Both of them are looking in the direction where the photograph was captured. Both of them are wearing a neck accessory around their neck that holds a flower, which hangs at their respective torsos.

metadata.subject_terms_2: Black-and-white photography Spouses Ethnic costume Portraits Portrait photography
metadata.sgcool_label_text: A native of Karuvakurichi village, near Mannargudi town in Tamil Nadu, S. Appavoo Kandiar was a general contractor specializing in pipe and cable laying, handling of cargo and a concrete bricks supplier. Mr.Kandiar was a successful contractor; called a millionaire by the Straits Times in 1957, he owned properties in Bukit Timah and Coronation Road areas. He was a contemporary of Indian pioneers such as P.Govindasamy Pillai, Govindasamy Sarangapany, Pakkirisami Pillai, and had friendly associations with them.
